task.description: Replace the air filter in your central HVAC system to ensure efficient heating and cooling.
task.why: Regular filter replacement improves air quality, reduces energy costs, and extends the life of your HVAC system.

steps.description: Turn off the HVAC system at the thermostat.
Locate the filter (usually near the furnace or return vent).
Remove the old filter and note its size (e.g., 16x25x1).
Insert a new filter, ensuring the airflow arrow matches the system's direction.
Turn the system back on and check airflow.

task.description: Inspect your asphalt shingle roof and clean the gutters to prevent leaks and water damage.
task.why: Regular roof inspections can identify minor issues before they become major problems, and clean gutters prevent water damage to your home's foundation and walls.

steps.description: Use a ladder to safely access the roof (or hire a professional if you're not comfortable with heights).
Check shingles for cracks, missing pieces, or wear.
Inspect flashing around chimneys and vents for gaps.
Clear gutters of leaves and debris using gloves or a scoop.
Test downspouts with a hose to ensure proper drainage.

task.description: Flush your water heater to remove sediment buildup, improving efficiency and extending its lifespan.
task.why: Sediment buildup in water heaters can reduce efficiency, increase energy costs, and shorten the appliance's lifespan.

steps.description: Turn off the water heater (gas or electric) and let it cool.
Shut off the cold water supply to the heater.
Attach a hose to the drain valve and run it outside or to a bucket.
Open the valve and drain until the water runs clear.
Close the valve, remove the hose, and restore power/water supply.

task.description: Inspect your basement for signs of moisture or water intrusion to prevent mold and structural damage.
task.why: Early detection of moisture issues can prevent mold growth, structural damage, and expensive repairs.

steps.description: Check walls and floors for visible water or damp spots.
Look for white mineral deposits (efflorescence) on walls, which indicate water seepage.
Inspect for musty odors or visible mold growth.
Check that sump pump is functioning properly (if applicable).
Ensure downspouts direct water away from foundation.

task.description: Inspect and replace weatherstripping around single-pane windows to improve energy efficiency.
task.why: Single-pane windows often leak air, and proper weatherstripping can significantly reduce heating and cooling costs.

steps.description: Inspect current weatherstripping for cracks, gaps, or compression.
Remove old weatherstripping if damaged.
Clean the surface with rubbing alcohol.
Measure and cut new weatherstripping to fit.
Apply new weatherstripping according to package instructions.

task.description: Perform seasonal maintenance on your yard to keep it healthy and attractive.
task.why: Regular yard maintenance prevents overgrowth, reduces pest issues, and maintains property value.

steps.description: Mow lawn to appropriate height for the season.
Trim bushes and hedges away from the house.
Remove weeds from garden beds and lawn.
Apply seasonal fertilizer if needed.
Check irrigation system for leaks or damage.

task.task_name: Smoke and Carbon Monoxide Detector Test
task.description: Test all smoke and carbon monoxide detectors to ensure they're functioning properly.
task.why: Functioning detectors are critical for early warning in case of fire or carbon monoxide leaks.

steps.description: Press the test button on each detector to ensure the alarm sounds.
Replace batteries if the alarm sounds weak or doesn't sound at all.
Check the manufacture date on each detector (usually on the back).
Replace detectors that are more than 10 years old (smoke) or 7 years old (CO).
Vacuum any dust from detector vents.

task.description: Clean vinyl siding to remove dirt, mildew, and stains.
task.why: Regular cleaning maintains your home's appearance and prevents mold and mildew growth.

steps.description: Mix a cleaning solution of 70% water and 30% white vinegar.
Apply solution with a soft-bristled brush or low-pressure sprayer.
Work from bottom to top to prevent streaking.
Rinse thoroughly with clean water.
Inspect for any damaged or loose siding pieces.

task.description: Perform maintenance on your garage door and opener to ensure safe and reliable operation.
task.why: Regular maintenance prevents garage door failures and extends the life of the door and opener.

steps.description: Inspect and tighten all hardware, including brackets, bolts, and roller wheels.
Lubricate moving parts with garage door lubricant (not WD-40).
Test the door balance by disconnecting the opener and manually lifting the door.
Test auto-reverse safety features by placing an object in the door's path.
Inspect weather stripping for damage and replace if necessary.

task.description: Inspect copper plumbing pipes for leaks, corrosion, or damage.
task.why: Copper pipes can develop pinhole leaks or corrosion over time, especially in areas with hard water.

steps.description: Check exposed pipes in basement, under sinks, and in utility areas.
Look for green discoloration, which indicates corrosion.
Feel along pipes for moisture or water damage on nearby surfaces.
Check water pressure at various faucets throughout the house.
Listen for unusual sounds in pipes when water is running.
